rice cracker, senbei, Japanese cracker, rice cookie, wafer

mochi rice cake
glutinous rice
kagami mochi, New Year offering consisting of two mochi stacked on each other with a bitter orange on top, cut and eaten on January 11
mooncake, disc-shaped confection of wheat-flour dough filled with bean paste, usu. eaten during Autumn in China
rice cakes, pounded mochi rice
abekawa mochi, rice cake with kinako
adzuki bean-covered mochi, botamochi
something useless, picture of rice cakes

sense.gloss: pie in the sky, castles in the air, drawing of a rice cake
konpeitō, small coloured sugar candy covered with tiny bulges
(blood) clot
jealous person
flattened rice cakes
thin bedding, hard bed, bedding worn flat and hard by usage
jealousy
roasted rice cake
falling on one's backside, pratfall
mochi used to celebrate a child's first birthday, mochi tied to a baby's back if he starts walking before his first birthday in order to cause him to fall on his backside
mochi made in winter
soft skin, smooth skin

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑夢↑↓ゆめ↓↑一↑↓いち↓↑杯↑↓はい↓のビジネスプラン、↑絵↑↓え↓に↑描↑↓えが↓いた↑餅↑↓もち↓にならんことを↑切↑↓せつ↓に↑望↑↓のぞ↓むよ。
sdata.e: This business plan of yours seems almost too optimistic. All I can say is I hope it's more than just wishful thinking.

sdata.j: ↑絵↑↓え↓に↑書↑↓か↓いた↑餅↑↓もち↓は↑食↑↓た↓べられない。
↑牡丹餅↑↓ぼたもち↓で↑腰↑↓こし↓↑打↑↓う↓つ。
sdata.e: His bread is buttered on both sides.
Every man for his own trade.

sdata.j: あらやだ、このお↑煎餅↑↓せんべい↓もう↑湿気↑↓しけ↓ってる。
sdata.e: Yecch. This rice cracker is soggy.

sdata.j: ↑棚↑↓たな↓からぼた↑餅↑↓もち↓とはこのことだ。
sdata.e: This is what they call a lucky break.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑餅↑↓もち↓をすっかり↑食↑↓た↓べたわけではない。
sdata.e: He didn't eat all of the rice cakes.
A specialist has his own strength.

sdata.j: ↑日本↑↓にっぽん↓ではお↑正月↑↓しょうがつ↓にお↑餅↑↓もち↓を↑食↑↓た↓べる↑習慣↑↓しゅうかん↓があります。
sdata.e: There is a custom of eating rice cakes for New Year's in Japan.

sdata.j: いいえ、お↑団子↑↓だんご↓はお↑餅↑↓もち↓ではありません。
sdata.e: No, a dango is not a mochi.

sdata.j: ↑月餅↑↓げっぺい↓↑買↑↓か↓ってきたけど、↑食↑↓た↓べる？
sdata.e: I bought some mooncake, do you want some?
